text: - Hello, and welcome to Community Chats.
I'm Aley Hammer.
And today we're interviewing Jamie Cairns,
the chief strategy officer over at Fluent.
Jamie, welcome to the show.
Can you start by telling our audience
a little bit about Fluent and your role?

- Fluent is a Australian
software as a service company,
we sell B2B predominantly for retailers
and direct to consumer brands.
And the area that we help them with
is management of inventory

which is the biggest
challenge in retail today.
Fluent order management is the product
that we bring to market.

My role within the company
is strategy officer

is kind of synthesizing
the market requirements,

how we can set the
standards in the market,
how we can build the right product
and work with our partners to deliver
really awesome experiences for clients.
- Thanks, Jamie.

And how has Fluent supported
retailers to innovate

during a time when COVID
has really impacted
a lot of consumers?

- Well, we've all been impacted
significantly, haven't we?
And our clients saw huge changes
in unprecedented timeframes.
So going from having shops that were open
to walk in customers coming in and buying,
through a huge boom in online retail,

particularly contactless
collections or deliveries.

And we saw a lot of our
clients changing the mix
of their stores.

So using stores as many
distribution centers,

doing contactless pick up,
buy online pickup in store,
curbside pickup, and so forth.
So we were able to help them.
It really hadn't changed the message

that we were talking to most
of our clients about anyway,
which was agility and flexibility

and the ability to adapt to
changing consumer demands.
So it was certainly accelerated

but we've seen folks being
able to rapidly adapt

by having a nice composable
commerce ecosystem
being able to make changes on the plan.

- And Jamie, Fluent has been
supporting global brands

such as L'Oreal, Ted Baker
in London to name a few.
So how does AWS actually help you
to support these global customers?

- Well, first of all, what
does those global customers
have in common, right?

They're complex, they have
huge amounts of scale,

they're absolutely focused on
their customers' experience.
So they're asking us to be able

to handle huge peaks in
scale at holiday seasons,
to be able to handle the complexity
of inventory across different locations,

to be able to and make
everything available

in the most convenient manner
possible for their customers.

And AWS really helps us
to be able to do that,

to be able to cost effectively
deliver that scale.
So the benefits of software as a service

need to be underpinned by
really powerful cloud computing.

And we're able to do that
not only with AWS technology
but also with the assistance
of the AWS folks that we work with,
who brings some great experience also.
- Well, it's been really cool to see
how Fluent has leveraged AWS services

and specialist engagements
to remain innovative.

And particularly what I wanted
to chat to you about, Jamie
was with the use of the data lab.

So can you share a little
bit more about this?

- So yeah, it's been a
fantastic experience.
So one thing I think is really challenging
is to try and find people to work with
who really understand our space,
to really understand inventory.
There aren't very many people out there
that understand that space

and that know the challenges
associated with it,

but also know how to be able
to average AWS technology
to really see results and improvements
in the performance of what we do.

So what we were able
to do was find somebody

within the AWS team
who was able to help us
in that data lab.
We didn't need to spend a week
explaining to them what we do.

So we were able to get right
into testing a hypothesis

that we had around how we
could make really a step change
in the processing efficiency of inventory.

The number one challenge
that our retailers face
is inventory management.

So we were able to do that
in a very short timeframe,

prove the hypothesis out and
we are straight into build.

So we were able to do that
in a week long process

that without the
combination of experience,

subject matter expertise
and technical knowhow

we would to really
struggle to get anywhere

near where we're at now
in that sort of timeframe.
- It's been so cool to watch your business
utilize the retail competency program

as well within our APN
and to witness all these

increased efficiencies as
a result of the data lab.
So congrats on that.
It's been an awesome journey

and I mean, one week is
so impressive as well.
Jamie, to round up this interview,
what kind of new technology
are you guys currently experimenting with
or wanting to see in the future?

- Yeah, predominantly it's
around the big data processing
and data lake tools.

So things like S3, Eventbridge,
Glue, Athena, Kinesis.

I think we've probably
listed most of them there,

but that was really off
the back of that data lab

and some of the work that
we've been doing previously.

Also my SVP of engineering would
kill me if I didn't mention

how excited he is about
the Aurora Serverless V2
upcoming project.
We've seen some really great results

utilizing previous versions
of that technology.
And just to round it out,

I mean, what we really need
to be able to to handle

on what AWS really helps
us with is peak scaling,
being able to handle the largest retailers

and brands in the world
without any kind of downtime.
So all of those technologies allow us
to really fulfill that promise
and do it in a cost effective way.

- Thank you so much, Jamie, I
personally love your company
because whenever I'm shopping online
you are the guys behind it
who's getting my goods to me quicker.
So thanks so much for making the processes
smooth for your customers.

And yeah, we really enjoyed
partnering with you.
So if anyone has any questions,

please pop them in the
comment section below
and we'll get back to you.
Thank you.
- Thanks having me, Aley.
